result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hayley M Chovan

records.addlTxt:
11:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hayley M Chovan in court.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Hayley M Chovan. A. Standaert - Clerk 

20CF208, 20CM381, 22CF88, 20TR1816, 20TR1817, 21TR250

Atty Lundeen - deft will enter plea to 20CF208 Ct 1 without repeater and Ct 4 without repeater, 20TR1817 - remaining counts and cases to be dismissed and read-in - 3 years probation, AODA, CS 30 hours, 90 days conditional jail - 60 days held in abeyance, follow rec of agent - $443 court costs on CM and $518 on CF

State - 20TR1817 - $811.50, $55 BDF, 6 mo DL rev, AODA, DSP, no IID
Atty Lundeen - deft is willing to serve 30 days jail soon

Deft - enters a no contest plea to Ct 1 in 20CF208 (without repeater) and a no contest plea to Ct 4 in 20CF208 (without repeater) and a no contest plea to 20TR1817, waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea.

Court - finds waiver of rights & plea voluntary, free & knowing & approves stip by parties to facts
Accepts no contest pleas and finds defendant guilty 

State - makes argument, asks Court to accept joint recommendation
Atty Lundeen - makes argument, also asks Court to accept joint recommendation

Court orders - 

  Count 1 of 20CF208 (concurrent to Count 4)
    -Withheld sentence, 3 years probation
        - Complete AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
        - Complete 30 hours of community service
        - 90 days conditional jail - 30 days to be served on or before May 16, 2022 at 5:00pm - 60 days to be held in abeyance for use by agent
        - Follow recommendations of agent
        - Pay court costs of $518
        - 2 days credit if revoked

  Count 4 of 20CF208 (concurrent to Count 1)
    -Withheld sentence, 3 years probation
        - Complete AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
        - Complete 30 hours of community service
        - 90 days conditional jail - 30 days to be served on or before May 16, 2022 at 5:00pm - 60 days to be held in abeyance for use by agent
        - Follow recommendations of agent
        - Pay court costs of $443

  20TR1817
        - Fine of $811.50
        - $55 blood draw fee
        - Driver's license revoked for 6 months
        - Complete AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan

Dismissed and read-in: Counts 2 & 3 of 20CF208, 20CM381, 22CF88, 20TR1816, and 21TR250
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Amber L Hahn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hayley M Chovan in court. Attorney Jonathan Lundeen appears by Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Lundeen - rcvd complaint - has not spoken to DE on this case. Needs to reapply for this case.
Court - explains to DE that they need to reapply when new charges get filed.
Atty Lundeen - go ahead with INIT. Waive reading and speedy time limits. 
DE - will contact PD's office.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on March 29, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Agreement to receive text message reminders for upcoming court dates.
